meanings.definition: securely or firmly fixed in place on the shore
meanings.sent1: The boat was tied shorefast to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The tent was set up shorefast on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The sandcastle stood shorefast against the incoming tide.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as shorefast as a lighthouse in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree held the soil shorefast, preventing erosion.

meanings.definition: a line or cable used to secure a vessel to the shore
meanings.sent1: The sailor grabbed the shorefast to moor the ship safely.
meanings.sent2: The strong shorefast kept the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent3: The captain tripped over the shorefast, causing a moment of chaos.
meanings.sent4: The shorefast was like a lifeline connecting the ship to the land.
meanings.sent5: The old rope served as a reliable shorefast for many years.
